intro: Tridentea juvencula, commonly known as the golden trident, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, which consist of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is often cultivated in gardens across southern Europe.
